adjectives.description: erasable (comparative more erasable, superlative most erasable)

examples: "Avoid the frustration of time-consuming do-overs on school projects. Try Crayola Erasable Markers, Crayons & colored pencils."

entries.meaning: Any recording medium whose contents can be erased.
examples: With the addition of the erasables, the company now offers what it describes as "a complete family" of optical recording products, including Videodisk, CD-ROM, CD-audio, and write-once units.
